00011 #include "CellTag.h"

00013 #include <util/global.h>

00015 class CellTest;
00016 class CellListTest;

00018 namespace McMd
00019 {
00020 
00021    using namespace Util;
00022 
00023    class Atom;
00024    
00040    class Cell 
00041    {
00042      
00043    public:
00044 
00046       static const int MaxAtomCell = 61; 
00047    
00049       static const int NullIndex   = -1; 
00050    
00054       Cell();
00055    
00059       void clear();
00060    
00066       void deleteAtom(CellTag &cellTag);
00067     
00077       void addAtom(CellTag &cellTag, Atom &atom, int cellId);
00078  
00080       int nAtomCell() const;
00081 
00083       int firstClearPos() const; 
00084         
00090       Atom* atomPtr(int index) const;
00091         
00106       bool isValid(const Array<CellTag> &cellTags, int nAtom, int icell) const;
00107    
00108    private:
00109    
00110       /*
00111       * Implementation notes:
00112       *
00113       * Pointers to atoms in a cell are stored in the atoms_[] array member.
00114       * "Empty" elements of atoms_[] must contain a null (i.e., 0) pointer.
00115       *
00116       * The total number of atoms in the cell in is nAtomCell_. The array 
00117       * index of the first empty element in the atoms_[] array is given by 
00118       * firstEmptyPos_. All elements of atoms_[] with indices greater than 
00119       * or equal to firstClearPos_ are empty. An element atoms_[i] with 
00120       * i < firstEmptyPos_ may not be empty, one with i >= firstClearPos_ must 
00121       * be empty, and one with firstEmptyPos_ < i and i < firstClearPos_ may or 
00122       * may not be empty. When firstClearPos_ > 0, atoms_[firstClearPos_-1] may 
00123       * not be empty, since this would imply that firstClearPos_ is not the 
00124       * first in the contiguous block of empty elements. These conditions are 
00125       * checked in the isValid() method. 
00126       */
00127    
00129       Atom* atoms_[MaxAtomCell]; 
00130    
00132       int   nAtomCell_;   
00133    
00135       int   firstEmptyPos_;  
00136    
00138       int   firstClearPos_; 
00139 
00140    //friends:
00141 
00142       //  Grant access to unit test classes
00143       friend class ::CellTest;
00144       friend class ::CellListTest;
00145 
00146    }; 
00147   
00148    // Inline functions
00149    
00150    /* 
00151    * Delete atom from Cell
00152    */
00153    inline void Cell::deleteAtom(CellTag &cellTag) 
00154    {
00155       int cellPos = cellTag.cellPos;
00156    
00157       // Delete atom from Cell member variables.
00158       // Set atoms_[cellPos] to 0 to mark empty.
00159       atoms_[cellPos] = 0;
00160       nAtomCell_--;
00161    
00162       // Reset firstEmptyPos_
00163       if (firstEmptyPos_ > cellPos) {
00164          firstEmptyPos_ = cellPos;
00165       }
00166    
00167       // Reset firstClearPos_
00168       int i = firstClearPos_ - 1;
00169       while (i >= 0 && atoms_[i] == 0) {
00170          i--;
00171       }
00172       firstClearPos_ = i + 1;
00173    
00174       // Reset cellTag cellId and cellPos to negative integer values 
00175       // to indicate that the atom is no longer associated with a Cell.
00176       cellTag.cellId  = NullIndex;
00177       cellTag.cellPos = NullIndex;
00178    
00179    }
00180    
00181    /* 
00182    * Add a atom to a Cell
00183    */
00184    inline void Cell::addAtom(CellTag &cellTag, Atom &atom, int cellId) 
00185    {
00186    
00187       // If cell is already full, throw Exception
00188       if (firstEmptyPos_ == MaxAtomCell) {
00189          UTIL_THROW("Too many atoms in one cell");
00190       }
00191        
00192       // Add atom to Cell
00193       atoms_[firstEmptyPos_] = &atom;
00194       ++nAtomCell_;
00195    
00196       // Record cell in cellTag
00197       cellTag.cellId  = cellId;
00198       cellTag.cellPos = firstEmptyPos_;
00199    
00200       // Reset firstEmptyPos_ and firstClearPos_
00201       if (firstEmptyPos_ < MaxAtomCell - 1) {
00202    
00203          if (firstEmptyPos_ == firstClearPos_) {
00204    
00205             firstEmptyPos_ = firstEmptyPos_ + 1;
00206             firstClearPos_ = firstClearPos_ + 1;
00207    
00208          } else {
00209    
00210             // Find the next empty element, for which atoms_[i] is null
00211             for (int i = firstEmptyPos_ + 1; i < MaxAtomCell; ++i) {
00212                if (atoms_[i] == 0) {
00213                   firstEmptyPos_ = i;
00214                   break;
00215                }
00216             }
00217    
00218          }
00219    
00220       } else { 
00221    
00222          // If firstEmptyPos_ was MaxAtomCell - 1, no empty slots remain.
00223          // Set firstEmptyPos_ = MaxAtomCell to indicate this condition.
00224          // Attempting to add one more atom will trigger an Exception.
00225          firstEmptyPos_ = MaxAtomCell;  // Note: Invalid array index
00226          firstClearPos_ = MaxAtomCell;  // Note: Invalid array index
00227    
00228       }
00229    }
00230 
00231    inline int Cell::nAtomCell() const
00232    { return nAtomCell_; }
00233          
00234    inline int Cell::firstClearPos() const
00235    { return firstClearPos_; }
00236 
00237    inline Atom* Cell::atomPtr(int index) const
00238    { return atoms_[index]; }
00239          
00240 }

00242 #endif
